events.title: The Scopes Trial Begins
events.description: John T. Scopes was indicted in Tennessee for teaching evolution in public school, challenging the Butler Act which outlawed the teaching of human evolution.
events.significance: The trial highlighted the conflict between modern science and religious fundamentalism in American education.

events.title: Allied Invasion of Sicily
events.description: During World War II, Allied forces began Operation Husky, the invasion of Sicily, marking the start of the Italian Campaign.
events.significance: This was a significant step towards the downfall of Mussolini and the Axis powers in Europe.

events.title: Telstar 1 Satellite Launch
events.description: The first active communications satellite, Telstar 1, was launched into orbit, enabling live transatlantic television broadcasts.
events.significance: This event marked a milestone in global communications and the space race.

events.title: The Death of Sitting Bull
events.description: Sitting Bull, the Hunkpapa Lakota leader and symbol of Native American resistance, was killed during an attempt to arrest him by Indian police.
events.significance: His death marked the decline of Native American resistance to U.S. government policies.

events.title: The Bahamas Gain Independence
events.description: The Commonwealth of the Bahamas gained full independence from the United Kingdom.
events.significance: Represented a major step in Caribbean decolonization and self-governance.
